name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Practical Economics
long_desc: While Economics is an applied science, it is oftentimes described in abstract terms and graphs. This class aims to show how Economics can be used in the real world to solve the biggest problems facing society. Students will learn about and discuss topics such as Game Theory, Behavioral Economics, Market Design, and the Nobel Prize. Students will better understand how to improve the world by making better decisions. No previous knowledge of Economics is needed.

custom_fields.goals: By the end of the course, students should be able to model a real world situation and solve for the Nash Equilbria, understand how behavioral tactics can be used to better act, and see how market design affects the real world.
custom_fields.key_topics: The course will cover topics such as Game Theory, Behavioral Economics, and Market Design. Additionally, the course will cover how these topics can be applied to the real world and limitations of these approaches.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Attendance and entrances quizzes are worth 35%, the midterm consisting of paragraph style questions is worth 30%, and the final is worth 35%.
custom_fields.relevance: Students will be able to harness economics tools to better plan their lives and understand how economic topics shape the world we live in.
custom_fields.learning_resources: A copy of the textbook will be provided by the instructor and supplementary papers and articles will be provided by the instructor.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: 1 hour of reading per week is expected of students.
